intro: Sedum talihsiense, commonly known as the Talihsi stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clustered leaves. The plant typically produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
